p: Heart failure is caused by any functional or structural damage to ventricular filling or in the blood ejection ( Klein et al., 2003). It is known as a leading cause of mortality in the western globe and tends to develop when cardiac injury or cardiac insult impairs the heartâ€™s ability to maintain and pump tissue perfusion ( Lymperopoulos et al., 2013). Hypertension, which is also known as a common CVD, is a crucial concern in health in diverse parts of the world. When the arterial pressure rises above 140/90 mm Hg., it is known as arterial hypertension ( Malik et al., 2018).
